intro: Isoloma elatius, commonly known as the tall dandelion, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of serrated, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into elongated, bristly seed heads. Isoloma elatius is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, thriving in temperate climates. Its botanical structure supports its role as a pioneer species in ecological succession.
